effect.author: Foxioo

parameter.name: /* Foxioo Ambient (Switch) Shader | 1.0 (21.11.2025) */
parameter.description: This shader is designed to manipulate colors to create ambient. With the right settings, it can simulate color effects of nighttime, storms, and similar conditions.

parameter.name: Blending Mode
parameter.description: This variable manages which color will be reduced. Set to 0 is the blend color will be reduced and set to 1 is the base color will be reduced.

parameter.name: Mixing
parameter.description: This variable is responsible for the visibility of the effect.

parameter.name: Exposure
parameter.description: This variable determines the brightness of the texture.

parameter.name: Contrast
parameter.description: This variable determines the difference between dark and light areas.

parameter.name: Saturation
parameter.description: This variable determines the saturation of texture colors.

parameter.name: Vibrance
parameter.description: This variable determines the saturation of colors that are less saturated.

parameter.name: Power
parameter.description: The variable determines to what power the colors should be raised.

parameter.name: Time
parameter.description: This variable is responsible for the time (0 - 24 Hours).

parameter.name: Temperature
parameter.description: This variable sets the color temperature.

parameter.name: Bloom
parameter.description: This variable determines the intensity of the bloom color effect.

parameter.name: Bloom Threshold
parameter.description: This variable determines the brightness level at which the bloom color effect begins to appear.

parameter.name: Addition Power
parameter.description: The variable determines how much color should be added.

parameter.name: Addition Color
parameter.description: The variable specifies exactly which color should be used for adding.

parameter.name: Multiplication Power
parameter.description: The variable determines how much the color should be multiplied.

parameter.name: Multiplication Color
parameter.description: The variable specifies exactly which color should be used for multiplication.

parameter.name: ( Compatibility )
parameter.description: Here you will find options that have changed, but you can still achieve the previous effect.

parameter.name: Is Fusion Version Older Than 296?
parameter.description: (Only applies to Android and iOS!) This variable determines whether to use the newer background formatting. In Clickteam Fusion 2.5 for build 295.10 and earlier, the background texture was flipped along the Y axis, but this was changed in build 296.1. Check this option if you are using an older build!
